intro: Tassadia recurva, commonly known as the curled tasselia, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its distinctive, spiraled inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a compact cluster that gives the plant its unique appearance. Tassadia recurva is often found in humid forests and is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role and ornamental value.
